subject.normal: [cdt-dev] debug - active build configuration changes during launch

headers.subject: RE: [cdt-dev] debug - active build configuration changes during launch
headers.thread-topic: [cdt-dev] debug - active build configuration changes during launch

body.para: To add a little more detail on this quickly evolving feature ;), the launchers can be aware of configurations, independend of the build system, and you should be able to set a configuration per launch config. We'd have to figure out the mechanism for how this configuration is set and returned properly when the pre-launch build is done, but then that's the root of the problem today...

quote.quotepara: -----Original Message----- From: cdt-dev-bounces@eclipse.org [mailto:cdt-dev-bounces@eclipse.org] On Behalf Of Schaefer, Doug Sent: Tuesday, October 28, 2008 5:47 PM To: CDT General developers list. Subject: RE: [cdt-dev] debug - active build configuration changes during launch

For 6.0, I want to add configuration to the CModel. A project can have different active configurations for different purposes. We already have the concept of separate ones for build and indexing. If we want a separate one for launching, I think we can do that.

-----Original Message----- From: cdt-dev-bounces@eclipse.org [mailto:cdt-dev-bounces@eclipse.org] On Behalf Of Ken Ryall Sent: Tuesday, October 28, 2008 5:34 PM To: CDT General developers list. Subject: Re: [cdt-dev] debug - active build configuration changes during launch
I'm not completely sure but I think the first thing I'll do is add a setting so you can disable this feature completely. Then I'll work on the other issues you mentioned.

From: ext Elena Laskavaia <elaskavaia@qnx.com> Organization: QNX Reply-To: "CDT General developers list." <cdt-dev@eclipse.org> Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2008 17:20:11 -0400 To: "CDT General developers list." <cdt-dev@eclipse.org> Subject: Re: [cdt-dev] debug - active build configuration changes during launch
Please describe how do you propose fixing it for 5.0.2?

I worked on this originally and I agree that it needs to be improved to handle the problems and use cases you mentioned. Please don't remove it. I'll work on some short term improvements for 5.0.2 and more for 6.0.

From: ext Elena Laskavaia <elaskavaia@qnx.com> Organization: QNX Reply-To: "CDT General developers list." <cdt-dev@eclipse.org> Date: Tue, 28 Oct 2008 16:48:34 -0400 To: "CDT General developers list." <cdt-dev@eclipse.org> Subject: [cdt-dev] debug - active build configuration changes during launch
We have a "feature" that launch config remembers first active launch configuration for managed projects and when it launches (if build when launch enabled) it is setting it to active and then builds.

This is really bad, because a) It does not restore active build config that was set by user, meaning my active config magically changes for unknown reason (I know why now...) b) If user changes project in launch config this magical build config does not change, so if you lucky you have same launch config in this another project and it will build, if not you get an NPE (bug236847 which is fixed on trunk by somebody) c) If user deletes related config same NPE d) There is no user setting that allow to change or even view config associated with the launch e) additionally if project is not managed project or not intent to be re-build when launching there is no way to specify it
I will remove this functionality in 5.0.2 (i.e. setting active config to "launch" related build config when building, it will build user selected active config). any objections?

For 6.0 we should implement proper fix: - support from UI - support when build config is deleted - support if different project is selected - support for "none" as build config - that allow not to build project for this launch
